definitions.definition: Very important ; noteworthy : having importance or significance in history .
examples: July 4, 1776, is a historic date. A great deal of historical research has been done on the events leading up to that day.
The historical works of Lord Macaulay and Edward Gibbon are in and of themselves historic .

definitions.definition: Synonym of historical : of, concerning , or in accordance with recorded history or the past generally ( See usage notes .)
Various grammatical tenses and moods specially used in retelling past events .
examples: The historic tenses include the imperfect , the pluperfect , and the future perfect .

main_definition: Very important ; noteworthy : having importance or significance in history .
secondary_definitions: ( now uncommon ) Synonym of historical : of, concerning , or in accordance with recorded history or the past generally ( See usage notes .)
( grammar ) Various grammatical tenses and moods specially used in retelling past events .
